title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 18
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Poor Peggy heard no more of Kirkpatrick.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: They accordingly descended into thevalley of the Nith, and committed great spoil onthe lands belonging to Douglas of Drumlanrig,Creichton Lord Sanquhar, Grierson of Lagg, andKirkpatrick of Closeburn, all of them independentbarons of high birth and great power.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Two gentlemen of the country, Lindesay and Kirkpatrick,friends of Bruce, were then in attendance on him.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Two gentlemen of the country, Lindesayand Kirkpatrick, friends of Bruce, were then in attendance on him.

title: Early Travellers in Scotland. Edited by P. Hume Brown. [With maps.]
author: Brown, Peter Hume.
snippet: Glasgowe, a very neate burgh towne lyeing upon the bankesof the river Cluyde, which, riseing in Anandale, runnes byGlasgowe and Kirkpatrick, disburthening it self into the Firthof Dunbarton.
